message: As a business, child trafficking operates on the same principles as the rest of the market: supply and demand. If demand remains at a certain level or increases, then there will be attempts to deliver a corresponding supply. There is currently an incredibly high demand for exploited children, both for sex and labor. Consumers play a large part in maintaining that demand, which means we also have the power to curb it.

data.description: By shifting our consumption habits and making changes to local legislation, we can curb the demand for child trafficking.
data.title: UNICEF USAVoice: Demanding An End To Child Trafficking And Forced Labor
